definitions.definition: To receive, especially with a consent, with favour, or with approval.
To admit to a place or a group.
definitions.example: The Boy Scouts were going to accept him as a member.

definitions.definition: To regard as proper, usual, true, or to believe in.
definitions.example: I accept the notion that Christ lived.

definitions.definition: To receive as adequate or satisfactory.
To receive or admit to; to agree to; to assent to; to submit to.
definitions.example: I accept your proposal, amendment, or excuse.
to accept the report of a committee
